questions.question: She advised him …………………………. medicine.
questions.description: Advise is followed by object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: They warned us …………………………….. late.
questions.description: The negative form of the infinitive is made by putting not before to.

questions.question: Who taught you ……………………………..?
questions.description: Teach is followed by object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: You must not miss ……………………………… him.
questions.description: Miss is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: I cannot permit you ……………………………..
questions.description: Permit is followed by object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: I suggest …………………………….. a doctor.
questions.description: Suggest is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: I saw him ……………………………. over the wall.
questions.description: After see, we can use an ing form or an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I can smell something …………………………
questions.description: Smell is followed by an ing form or an infinitive without to.

questions.question: She caught him ……………………………… her letters.
questions.description: Catch is followed by an ing form or an infinitive without to.

questions.question: She kept the fire ……………………………………
questions.description: Keep is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: They made him …………………………………..
questions.description: Make is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: We found the house ………………………….
questions.description: Here the meaning is passive – the house was deserted. Hence the past participle is used after find.
